content.raw:
# Summary

The documentation,  code style, and scripting interfaces in this library needs to be updated. This issue will track progress.

# Work to be done

For each class:

1. Create an example in the `examples` folder. This example should then be used as a doxygen `\snippet` in the class's doxygen description.

2. Check spelling.

3. Check for code style. Set functions should start with `Set`. Don't use `const` with POD types. Etc.

4. Create a scripting interface. See Angle.i as an example.

5. Add more tests so that  coverage is as close to 100% as possible.

6. Target changes to ign-math6. Also, target `default` with any breaking changes.

# Status

1. [x] Angle. See pull request #325 and pull request #326
2. [ ] AxisAlignedBox
3. [ ] Box
4. [ ] Color
5. [ ] Cylinder
6. [ ] DiffDriveOdometry
7. [ ] Filter
8. [ ] Frustum
9. [ ] graph/Edge
10. [ ] graph/GraphAlgorithms
11. [ ] graph/Graph
12. [ ] graph/Vertex
13. [X ] Helpers. See pull request #330.
14. [ ] Inertial
15. [ ] Kmeans
16. [ ] Line2
17. [ ] Line3
18. [ ] MassMatrix3
19. [ ] Material
20. [ ] MaterialType
21. [X ] Matrix3. See pull request #328
22. [ ] Matrix4
23. [ ] MovingWindowFilter
24. [ ] OrientedBox
25. [ ] PID
26. [ ] Plane
27. [X ] Pose3. See pull request #329.
28. [X] Quaternion. See pull request #327.
29. [ ] Rand
30. [ ] RollingMean
31. [ ] RotationSpline
32. [ ] SemanticVersion
33. [ ] SignalStats
34. [ ] Sphere
35. [ ] SphericalCoordiantes
36. [ ] Spline
37. [ ] Stopwatch
38. [X] Temperature. See pull request #339.
39. [ ] Triangle3
40. [ ] Triangle
41. [ ] Vector2
42. [ ] Vector3
43. [ ] Vector3Stats
44. [ ] Vector4

Summary

The documentation, code style, and scripting interfaces in this library needs to be updated. This issue will track progress.

Work to be done

For each class:

  1. Create an example in the examples folder. This example should then be used as a doxygen \snippet in the class's doxygen description.

  2. Check spelling.

  3. Check for code style. Set functions should start with Set. Don't use const with POD types. Etc.

  4. Create a scripting interface. See Angle.i as an example.

  5. Add more tests so that coverage is as close to 100% as possible.

  6. Target changes to ign-math6. Also, target default with any breaking changes.

content.raw:
# Summary

Basically, I’d like to add a function that would do the same as

```
math::Vector3d v = ...;
v.Abs().Max()
v.Abs().Min()
```

but without the unnecessary cost for creating new objects.

# Motivation

Sometimes one is not interested in positiveness/negativeness of the values in a vector, but just in their magnitude.

# Describe alternatives you've considered

One can use the Abs\(\).Max\(\) chain, but that leads to unncessary temporary object construction \(unless the compiler optimizes it very well\).

I’m not really sure about the name of the new methods, though. Alternatively, MaxMagnitude/MinMagnitude, MaxAbs/MinAbs…

# Additional context

‌
content.html:
Summary

Basically, I’d like to add a function that would do the same as

math::Vector3d v = ...;
v.Abs().Max()
v.Abs().Min()

but without the unnecessary cost for creating new objects.

Motivation

Sometimes one is not interested in positiveness/negativeness of the values in a vector, but just in their magnitude.

Describe alternatives you've considered

One can use the Abs().Max() chain, but that leads to unncessary temporary object construction (unless the compiler optimizes it very well).

I’m not really sure about the name of the new methods, though. Alternatively, MaxMagnitude/MinMagnitude, MaxAbs/MinAbs…

Additional context

‌

values.title: Wall of warnings in a souce build

content.raw:
# Prerequisites
* [x] Checked the Q&A board for common solutions: http://answers.gazebosim.org
* [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed.
* [x] Checked that there is not already an Ignition package that provides the described functionality: https://ignitionrobotics.org/libs

# Description 

Build time warnings (loads of them) cluttering the output and make it difficult to see important warnings in other projects in parallel builds.

# Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the default tag version
2. Compile using default arguments
3. Use gcc-latest (9) to do so

**Expected behavior:**  

No warnings (or limited warnings)

**Actual behavior:**

Wall of warnings

**Reproduces how often:** 

100%

# Versions

Arch Linux, GCC-9, CMake 3.15

# Additional Information

[Pastebin](https://pastebin.com/dWvZhibr)
content.html:

  • [x] Checked the Q&A board for common solutions: http://answers.gazebosim.org
  • [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed.

Build time warnings (loads of them) cluttering the output and make it difficult to see important warnings in other projects in parallel builds.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. Download the default tag version
  2. Compile using default arguments
  3. Use gcc-latest (9) to do so

Expected behavior:

Actual behavior:

Wall of warnings

Reproduces how often:

100%

Additional Information

Pastebin

content.raw:
# Prerequisites

* [ ] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:  
       * Checked the Q&A board for common solutions: http://answers.gazebosim.org  
    X  * Checked that your issue isn't already filed.  
   N/A * Checked that there is not already an Ignition package that provides the described functionality: https://ignitionrobotics.org/libs

# Description 

I am trying to install ignition-math 6.4.0, but the build fails for me. 

# Steps to Reproduce

1. mkdir build && cd build && cmake .. -DCMAKE\_BUILD\_TYPE=Release  
2. make

**Expected behavior:**  

The build should succeed.

**Actual behavior:**

Errors out. Build log: https://gist.github.com/acxz/b82cb035afa55339387361ba62353a9a

**Reproduces how often:** 

100%

# Versions

ArchLinux  
GCC: 9.2  
Ruby: 2.7.0

# Additional Information

Note: Downgrading to ruby 2.6.5 allows for the build to succeed.

‌
content.html:

      N/A * Checked that there is not already an Ignition package that provides the described functionality: https://ignitionrobotics.org/libs

Description

I am trying to install ignition-math 6.4.0, but the build fails for me.

Steps to Reproduce

  1. mkdir build && cd build && cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
  2. make

Expected behavior:

The build should succeed.

Actual behavior:

Reproduces how often:

100%

Versions

ArchLinux
GCC: 9.2
Ruby: 2.7.0

Additional Information

Note: Downgrading to ruby 2.6.5 allows for the build to succeed.

values.title: [Window] Error when install ign-math on Window10

content.raw:
Hello everyone.I tried to install Gazebo on window10 following the tutorial on here [http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install\_on\_windows&cat=install](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_windows&cat=install)  
But when I tried to configure ign-math \( step 9\). It keeps saying the following error  
" Could not find a package configuration file provided by "ignition-cmake2" "  
I tried to clone ignition-cmake2 into folder "gz-ws" and configure it and succeeded. But ign-math still not worked.  
The same issue happen with ign-transport, it require ignition-cmake0. Could anyone help me.  
Thanks for reading
content.html:
Hello everyone.I tried to install Gazebo on window10 following the tutorial on here http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_on_windows&cat=install
But when I tried to configure ign-math ( step 9). It keeps saying the following error
" Could not find a package configuration file provided by "ignition-cmake2" "
I tried to clone ignition-cmake2 into folder "gz-ws" and configure it and succeeded. But ign-math still not worked.
The same issue happen with ign-transport, it require ignition-cmake0. Could anyone help me.
Thanks for reading
